main event: A witness reported seeing a silver, disc-shaped unidentified aerial object hovering in the sky over St. Louis, Missouri on May 5, 1967.
interesting points: The object was approximately 20-30 feet in diameter and hovered silently for several minutes before rapidly accelerating and disappearing from sight.
The witness, a 48-year-old engineer named Joseph Mack, immediately reported the sighting to the local police department.
The case was investigated by Project Blue Book, the official U.S. Air Force program for investigating UFOs, and was classified as an 'Unidentified' sighting.
The report includes two photographs that appear to show an unidentified aerial object, although the quality is poor and the object is difficult to make out.
This sighting occurred just two years after the closure of Project Blue Book in 1969, highlighting the continued interest and investigation of UFO phenomena by the U.S. government.
photographs: yes, the report includes two photographs, although the quality is poor
